thread.title: Rutgers vs. Michigan State live steam: TV, time, channel, how to watch online
thread.title_full: Rutgers vs. Michigan State live steam: TV, time, channel, how to watch online | NJ.com

author: Dan Duggan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Rutgers vs. Michigan State live steam: TV, time, channel, how to watch online
text:
PISCATAWAY â€” The last time Rutgers hosted a Big Ten opponent in prime-time, the result was memorable, as fans stormed the field after the Scarlet Knights knocked off Michigan last October.
Rutgers will try to recapture that magic on Saturday, although No. 4 Michigan State poses a much stiffer challenge. The Scarlet Knights will try to ride the energy of the home crowd during the program's annual "blackout game."
The game will be broadcast nationally by the Big Ten Network. This will be the Knights' second prime-time BTN game of the season, as they lost 28-3 at Penn State earlier this season .
This is Rutgers' third straight game on the Big Ten Network. The Knights have also appeared on ESPNU and ESPNews this season. The BTN announcing team of Cory Provus and Chuck Long will call their first Rutgers game of the season on Saturday.
Here's everything you need to know about Saturday afternoon's matchup:
When: Saturday, Oct. 10 at 8 p.m.
Where: High Point Solutions Stadium, Piscataway, N.J.
TV: BTN... Cory Provus and Chuck Long will call the game, with J Leman working the sidelines
Radio: 570-WMCA; 1450-WCTC; 97.3-WENJ; 800-WTMR...Chris Carlin, Ray Lucas and Eric LeGrand will call the game, with Anthony Fucilli working the sidelines
Live stream: BTN.com
Line: Michigan State -13.5
Here are five stories you need to read to get ready for the game:
1. Rutgers receiver Leonte Carroo says he's 'blessed' to be back
2. Rutgers needs a victory (or at least a moral one) against Michigan State.
3. Rutgers wants to make Michigan State answer for fake field goal
4. Rutgers draws motivation from blowout loss to Michigan State last year
5. The five keys to the game for Rutgers.
